intro: Alsine longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed alsike, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, adapting to grow in various soil types. Alsine longipes is often found in meadows and along roadsides, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
